alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 18 at 6:05PM PDT until August 18 at 7:30PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: The National Weather Service in Reno has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Tamarack burn scar in... Alpine County in northern California... Northern Mono County in northern California... Douglas County in western Nevada... * Until 730 PM PDT. * At 605 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Tamarack Burn Scar. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 to 0.5 inches in 30 minutes. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Tamarack Burn Scar. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Tamarack Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Tamarack Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Topaz Lake, Holbrook Junction, Monitor Pass and Topaz Lake Campground. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.5 INCHES IN 30 MINUTES
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Tamarack Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
